ygData.authorName: Reece Tom R CPT 25 ID L G4
ygData.from: Reece Tom R CPT 25 ID L G4 <g4mntofcr@...>
ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Pixie Strike
ygData.msgSnippet: Isn t 120 CHR a breakpoint for crowd control?  For example, assuming your level and mob level stays the same, a bard with a 120 charisma will get charm/pixie
ygData.messageBody:
Isn't 120 CHR a breakpoint for crowd control? For example, assuming your
level and mob level stays the same, a bard with a 120 charisma will get
charm/pixie strike to stick a lot easier than if their charisma is 119 or
lower. I vaguely recall someone posting that a long time ago.

Galtin of E'ci

-----Original Message-----
From: Jeffrey Sue [mailto:jsue@...]
Sent: Wednesday, February 07, 2001 11:36 AM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Pixie Strike


At 02:31 PM 2/7/01 -0500, you wrote:
>I have both set to go. I've been looking foward to being an "enchanting
>bard"...heh, so I've got my charisma almost set. Borrowed a crude stein
>until my 2 +7 charisma rings come in. :)
>
>My theory is, the first add can do my bidding while others wait their turn.
>:)
>
>Not sure how practical that is, yet. Not much chance to try. I'll be out
>there tonight, though!
>
>Atonal

i have no problems charming with cha of 120ish. i would suggest going full
ac and hp if you are going to charm, cuz you WILL get hit in between charms,
and occasionally they will stun you and it'll take a few secs to get the
charm off,
etc etc.




Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
